channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Knowing two languages makes you better at learning other languages, new research shows—and it also alters how you think https://t.co/u4I8iuuSnB

Taiwan’s ruling party claimed a decisive victory in a referendum vote Saturday, in a setback for Beijing that removes a key obstacle to a U.S. trade deal with the democratically governed island https://t.co/JqfupaNKtI
Blockchain entrepreneur Jonathan Yantis purchased a 45,000 square foot Colorado mansion for $12.5 million from Cal Turner Jr., the former CEO of Dollar General https://t.co/zD1nDE5fw1
The FDA is allowing women to get the abortion pill mifepristone by mail, lifting a requirement that they must go to a medical office or hospital to get it https://t.co/El99q5BzNH
Namibia is positioning itself as a leader in the emerging market for green hydrogen made from renewable electricity, which has great potential in the country https://t.co/e5oJbp0LVY
It’s not just the accent: Ted Lasso’s pop-culture references come so fast and furious that you’ve probably missed a lot. We’re here to help. https://t.co/kzvwI1LokL
Masayuki Uemura, who has died at 78, worked with Ricoh to supply a chip that jolted “Super Mario Bros” to life https://t.co/6mhQSMkZUk
Toyota plans global sales of 3.5 million electric vehicles by 2030 and intends to make the Lexus brand 100% electric by 2035 https://t.co/s2IhyPHdga

From @WSJopinion: America’s future depends on the blockchain, writes Jay Clayton. The U.S. needs to act fast to preserve its advantage in the ‘tokenization’ of our financial infrastructure. https://t.co/K5fqDfjitS
CNN is closing its offices to nonessential employees as Covid-19 cases spike https://t.co/3tzmAVmnIo
It's OK if you don't really understand cryptocurrency. This is how it works. https://t.co/GHZlGEwrwl
Some of the people who built the internet think it’s time for a reboot—starting with social media https://t.co/TRUEi1ya5i
Logic’s hit song “1-800-273-8255” led to higher call volume and a decrease in suicides, research shows https://t.co/0Msot0aLPw
In a nuclear bunker under a mountain in New Jersey sits a remarkable secret treasure: tapes of every NBA game in the league’s archives https://t.co/KuqzpEgVkw
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/wYG6dx81C0 https://t.co/oufJ09n24o
An overdose epidemic that has swept across North America is leading more cities to try to decriminalize small amounts of heroin, fentanyl, cocaine and other drugs https://t.co/p29wC7bZCN
The Omicron variant appears better able to break into cells and evade immunity, and seems to replicate faster in the airways than the Delta variant https://t.co/9oGbCRDAeO

From @WSJopinion: If Democrats lack the votes to pass their spending bill, the fault lies with Democratic leaders who misjudged Sen. Joe Manchin as well as the political and policy moment https://t.co/YGhxmxbodz
In an interview with WSJ, Vice President Kamala Harris said that she and President Biden have never discussed whether he plans to run for re-election https://t.co/sxu3YqJGUx https://t.co/mfEuznxKy5
From @WSJopinion: President Biden’s stalled agenda is no one’s fault but his own, the result of an epic miscalculation of his mandate and votes, writes @KimStrassel https://t.co/LmxXSCVn4z
Pfizer pushed back plans to seek authorization of its Covid vaccine in children 2 to 5 years old, after a weaker-than-expected immune response in a study https://t.co/tMYNYMwXdq

Electric-vehicle startup Rivian plans to start construction next year on a second U.S. manufacturing facility in Georgia, placing a hefty bet on its ability to steadily increase sales in the coming years https://t.co/XpCrzSmqgG
Obituary: Nintendo videogame engineer Masayuki Uemura, who has died at 78, worked with a semiconductor maker to supply a chip that jolted “Super Mario Bros” to life https://t.co/vMkHkeKZ4w
In a nuclear bunker under a mountain in New Jersey sits a remarkable secret treasure: tapes of every NBA game in the league’s archives https://t.co/kzsQSzkqUo
A federal appeals court reinstated Biden’s Covid-19 requirements that large employers ensure workers are vaccinated or tested weekly for the virus https://t.co/yMF0U3Ypb6
The decimated Brooklyn Nets are bringing back unvaccinated Kyrie Irving for road games, the latest unexpected twist in one of the world’s most consequential vaccine standoffs https://t.co/0N8nCgquUZ
With dozens of opposition lawmakers in jail, Hong Kong is preparing to hold its first election under Beijing’s new rules, but polls point to a historic drop in turnout https://t.co/WeItU5vTRu
The U.S. is considering redirecting military equipment once bound for Afghanistan to Ukraine to reinforce its defenses against Russia, officials said https://t.co/TwotInRSeg
A gang called the Zouk family is running wild in Singapore. They are otters. “They aren’t nice little puppies.” https://t.co/bnkJSOXmZf
Millennials’ growing appetite for homeownership is boosting demand for housing that economists think will remain strong for years, explains @davidhodari #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/a76VOyWWD2
Knowing two languages makes you better at learning other languages, new research shows—and it also alters how you think https://t.co/w08nuJWdwp

A federal judge overturned a roughly $4.5 billion settlement between OxyContin maker Purdue and members of the Sackler family who own the drugmaker, a surprising decision that raises questions about the future of the company and its owners https://t.co/PnCb549Zki
A gang called the Zouk family is running wild in Singapore. They are otters. “They aren’t nice little puppies.” https://t.co/ccTWELjJYJ
The FDA is allowing women to get the abortion pill mifepristone by mail, lifting a requirement that they must go to a medical office or hospital to get it https://t.co/wyWmxtCfBs

Bruce Springsteen sold his music rights to Sony Music Entertainment for around $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter. The deal is the largest transaction ever for the life’s work of an individual artist. https://t.co/I32Vd4RecL
CDC advisers recommended adults take Pfizer or Moderna Covid vaccines over Johnson & Johnson’s due to a risk of rare clotting cases tied to the J&J shot https://t.co/MrUu8BgBeS
Haitian kidnappers released the remaining 12 missionary hostages abducted two months ago. Five others had been freed earlier. https://t.co/U9mG8DqZ8b

German officials are growing worried about the radicalization of some antivaccine militants as the country edges toward a general Covid-19 vaccine mandate that could come early next year https://t.co/6ZT4MOSacr

From @WSJopinion: Some 30 major cities across the U.S. are recording record or near-record homicides this year, writes @DanHenninger. Maybe voters are starting to regret the consequences of electing progressive prosecutors. https://t.co/CJJPbRYjfZ

German officials are growing worried about the radicalization of some antivaccine militants as the country edges toward a general Covid-19 vaccine mandate that could come early next year https://t.co/EW6upqjm7R
Reddit says it has confidentially filed paperwork with the SEC to begin the process of going public https://t.co/TQU87ILi49
“The science on lead is settled—there is no safe level of exposure”: The White House is set to announce a plan to help millions of U.S. households replace lead water pipes https://t.co/IIm6vV7Qky

Surging Covid-19 infections, hospitalizations and deaths are prompting South Korea to reverse plans to reopen and instead take some of the most aggressive measures against the virus of any country in the world https://t.co/AwDUEv44X2
The Jacksonville Jaguars fired Urban Meyer, ending his tumultuous NFL tenure after just 13 games https://t.co/FisPOUX734
Most Fed officials signaled they were prepared to raise rates at least three times next year to cool high inflation https://t.co/kkkOEFTTQy
President Biden will nominate Caroline Kennedy to be U.S. ambassador to Australia, the White House said Wednesday https://t.co/pplUHNOAh9

From @WSJopinion: Whether war breaks out will depend on how badly Beijing and Moscow fear the global power shift in the next decade and how eager they will be to exploit their perceived current relative advantages to remake the world, writes @andrewmichta https://t.co/CwCfJH1Yuq
During the pandemic, the number of people moving to California fell 38%, a new study found. In the San Francisco Bay Area, new arrivals plummeted 45% https://t.co/9XVLV6m1t7

The Democratic-controlled House has voted to hold Trump’s final chief of staff, Mark Meadows, in criminal contempt of Congress for defying a subpoena to testify to the panel investigating the Capitol riot https://t.co/1zzjK1p3t6
